intro: Odontarrhena gevgelicensis, commonly known as the Armenian toothbrush plant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are usually pink or red in color. Odontarrhena gevgelicensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
